subject: Investing
title: Covered Call Strategies for Extra Income
description: One-minute skill: Covered Call Strategies for Extra Income.

hook.text: An investor earned an extra 6% yield on top of dividends by selling options on stocks she already owned.

buildup.text: A covered call means selling someone the right to buy your shares at a higher price within a set timeframe.

discovery.text: You collect the option premium as income. If the stock stays below the strike price, you keep shares and premium.

twist.text: The trade-off: if the stock surges past your strike price, you miss the upside beyond that point.

climax.text: Covered call ETFs like JEPI and QYLD automate this strategy, delivering monthly income to shareholders.

punchline.text: Covered calls trade upside for income. In flat markets, that's a winning swap.

quiz.question: What is the trade-off of a covered call strategy?
options: You cap your upside in exchange for premium income
You must sell your shares immediately
